snippet: Republicans on a House panel said the frequencies should instead be auctioned to telecommunications companies, because that might raise up to $19 billion.
abstract: House Republicans warn Federal Communications Commission against 'giving away' scarce airwaves that they say could produce up to $19 billion in proceeds if they were instead auctioned to telecommunications companies for use in mobile broadband networks.
lead_paragraph: Republicans on a House panel said the frequencies should instead be auctioned to telecommunications companies, because that might raise up to $19 billion.

headline.main: G.O.P. Balks at Plan to Add Airwaves for Mobile Internet and Wi-Fi
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Balks at Plan to Add Airwaves for Mobile Internet and Wi-Fi
